instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 green light on mag flickers off briefly and SMC_PM_G2_EN not staying 3.4V
threads.message: I've got what I think is an odd situation. Green light on magsafe is not completely steady on, it pulses briefly and consistently. Same with SMC_PM_G2_EN it ranges from 1.7 to 3.4.  And DCIN fluctruates a little 16.5-16.8. I've changed SMC and U7941. With U7941 removed, SMC_PM_G2EN and DCIN are steady. I also changed Q7080/5 prior thinking that was related to DCIN values not steady. It's almost like something is causing the board to completely shut down and restart? Like even the sysonewire is resetting or something.  I also tried running from power supply instead of Magasafe and that keeps DCIN steady but still unsteady SMC_PM_G2_EN.  SMC Bypass doesn't change anything.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light on mag flickers off briefly and SMC_PM_G2_EN not staying 3.4V
threads.message: DAH! I no sooner posted and retraced tracks and I have a dead short on PP5v_S3 *facepalm* I must've missed it when I checked coils previously.

threads.title: 820-3115 green light on mag flickers off briefly and SMC_PM_G2_EN not staying 3.4V
threads.message: I wasted a ton of time on this board. Once I realized the short on PP5V_S3, I pulled the usual suspects: C6213/4 and short is gone.
